content: multiple arithmetic formats, and multiple address spaces for robust interprocess security. The IBM z16 system design features the following main objectives:  Offer a data-centric approach to information (data) security that is simple, transparent, and consumable (extensive data encryption from inception to archive, in-flight, and at-rest).  Offer a flexible infrastructure to concurrently accommodate a wide range of operating systems and applications, from the traditional systems (for example, z/OS and z/VM) to the world of Linux, cloud, analytics, and mobile computing.  Offer state-of-the-art integration capability for server consolidation by using virtualization capabilities in a highly secure environment: – Logical partitioning, which allows up to 85 independent logical servers. – z/VM, which can virtualize hundreds to thousands of servers as independently running virtual machines (guests). 70 IBM z16 (3931) Technical Guide – HiperSockets, which implement virtual LANs between
